original: Berggren, Ivar Carl Folke, direktör, Kalmar, f. 4/5/95 i iCalmar av groB’S-handl. Carl B. o. Lydia Sjögren. G. 25 m. Birgit Hofverberg. Barn: Gunnel f. 31. — Elev v. Kalm. lärov. 05-12, Kalm. hand :inst. 13, prakt. stud. i Malmö 14. Stud:res. i Tyskl. o. Ös-terr. 21. Intr. i A-B Bröd. Berggren i Kalmar 14, fam:bol. 23, styr :led. o. v. verkst. dir., fr. 45 verkst. direktör. Ordf. i Kalm. 1. beklädn:- o. manuf:-handl :fören., köpmannafören., und:-stödsfören., v. ordf. i Helgerums slott u. p. a., fullm. i Sv:es köpm:förb., ’Styr:led. i Kalm. köpm:fören., Kalm. 1. köpm:fören., i Barnensdagfören., Kalm. sommarstuga, Kristoffergili., högerfören., Smål. banks Kalm:kont., sekr. o. kass. i De blindas vänner i Kalm., huv:man o. styr:suppl. i Kalm. stads sparb., led. av kyrkofullm., kyrkoråd, tax:nd, prövn:nd, suppl. i div. styr. o. ndr. Medl. av Frimurarorden, Odd Fellow. SvKFBhed:t.
translated: Berggren, Ivar Carl Folke, director, Kalmar, born on May 4th, 1895 in Kalmar to the wholesale merchant Carl B. and Lydia Sjögren. Married on May 25th to Birgit Hofverberg, with one child: Gunnel, born in 1931. He attended Kalmar high school from 1905-1912 and Kalmar Institute of Commerce in 1913, and completed practical studies in Malmö in 1914. He undertook study trips to Germany and Austria in 1921. He started working for AB Bröd. Berggren in Kalmar in 1914, became a family member in 1923, served as a board member and deputy managing director, and from 1945 as managing director. He held numerous positions of responsibility including chairman of Kalmar's clothing and manufacturing trade association, merchant association and welfare association for the underprivileged, vice chairman of Helgerum Castle and council member of the Swedish Commercial Federation. He was also a board member of Kalmar's merchant association, Kalmar's first merchant association, the Children's Day Association, Kalmar's summer cottage, Kristoffergili, the right-wing association, Småland Bank's Kalmar branch, secretary and treasurer of the Friends of the Blind in Kalmar, head and board deputy of Kalmar City Savings Bank, member of the church council, tax committee, trial committee and board member of various other organizations. He was a member of the Freemasons, Odd Fellows, and Swedish Genealogical Society.
